group_1.narration: If you don't intend to change the world,@stop creating.

group_1.textCenter: (Are they trying to say that every work of@art I create...)
(This is the first time my value as an artist@has been questioned, rather than my art...)

group_1.narration: "Yet with no discernible themes, your art is @a powerful drug that may drive people mad."

group_1.textCenter: (That must mean that my art has the@potential to be poison or medicine...)
(To be honest, I don't really care...)
Even I, Alina, don't understand my reasons@for creating...
Maybe I should look back over the path I've@followed...

group_1.textRight: I believe an exhibition of my art is coming@up soon.
Do you have one of those profile boards that@will be displayed alongside my work?
I think they made one with the information@my parents sent over.
I wanted to look it over.
Photos of me when I was younger...and way too@many details...
Is it possible to have this replaced?
I'll send a more basic one over.

group_1.narration: 0: Born in Sakae Ward, Kamihama City.@2+: She grows up surrounded by many art@pieces at Gallery Gray in her parents' home.
8: After the passing of her grandparents and@dog, she realizes the animate can become@inanimate and attempts to depict that shift.
10: She experiments by making life and death@composites with time-lapse photography and@creating skeletons that appear to be moving.
11: "3D Art: Living Monochrome"@A vivid and psychedelic art piece that takes@a monochromatic skeleton that symbolizes@death and brings it to life with color.

12: "Pictoral Art: Scream of the Enlightened"@A scream of pain is the amalgam of instinct,@emotion, and reason at their maximum limits.@This work, born from that powerful stimulus,@is an expression of impact and intuition.

13: "Installation Art: Pack of One"@A contemporary dance depicting the existence@of one who can't fit in, based on footage of@a static individual among a kinetic crowd.@The theme of this piece is life.
14: "Pictoral Art: The Revived Dead"@Drawn with the charcoal of burned cadavers,@this collection strives not to create@new life, but to resurrect life that was.@A complete expression of life.

3D Art: A Testimonial Engine of the Samsara and H2O@Photograph: Digital Dead Life@Pictoral Art: Faces of Those Without Family@Installation Art: At the Soldier's Feet@Pictoral Art: Does Nothingness Take All?

group_1.textCenter: Even when I look back, there's no specific@theme.
If anything gave me a thrill or excited@me...
I brought it to life in my own way.

group_1.narration: "Yet with no discernible themes, your art is @a powerful drug that may drive people mad."
"If you don't intend to change the world,@stop creating."

group_1.textLeft: I just wanted to say, I think your artwork@is truly incredible...
I don't really understand how, but it draws@me in.
I could stare at it forever. It's scary, but@I'm also not scared of it.
That must mean they're true masterpieces.

group_1.textRight: Is that supposed to be a compliment?

group_1.textCenter: So you've been afflicted by my poison as@well?
My light will burn out soon. Maybe the judge@was right.
If those words are true, then I, Alina, must@stop creating.
